nodes.notes: This manualTrigger node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Get all records with an image URL
nodes.notes: This airtable node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Update attachment field with images
nodes.notes: This airtable node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
## Read me
Super simple workflow to upload image URLs as attachments in Airtable. [Here's the example Airtable database I used for this workflow.]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

1. Set up your Airtable database with one text field which contains image URLs, and an attachment field. 
![Source example]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}<IMAGE-NAME>.png#full-width)

2. In each Airtable node, add your Airtable credentials and connect to the base and table you want to modify.

3. In the "Get all records with an image URL" node under "Filter by Formula", change the field name from "Image Source URL" to whatever your URL field name is.
![Source example]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}<IMAGE-NAME>.png)

4. In the third node "Update attachment field with images", update the expression with the correct field name for the URL field. 
![Source example]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}<IMAGE-NAME>.png)

5. Click "Execute Workflow" and watch the magic happen!

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Manualtrigger Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Manualtrigger Workflow. This workflow integrates 3 different services: stickyNote, manualTrigger, airtable. It contains 4 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 4
- **Node Types**: 3
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **When clicking "Execute Workflow"**: manualTrigger
- **Get all records with an image URL**: airtable
- **Update attachment field with images**: airtable
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
